intro: Metrosideros quinquenervia, commonly known as the Hawaiian Christmas bush, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers, which bloom in clusters and are highly visible against the green foliage. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have five distinct veins, giving it the scientific name "quinquenervia." The species is well adapted to coastal and disturbed habitats, often thriving in nutrient-poor soils.
